intro: Bryodesma densum, commonly known as the dense bryodesma, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Bryodesma densum is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
